summary.long: 1 Thessalonians is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text:
Paul, Silvanus, and Timothy,
To the church of the Thessalonians in God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ: Grace to you and peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We always give thanks to God for all of you, making mention of you in our prayers;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: constantly keeping in mind your work of faith and labor of love and perseverance of hope in our Lord Jesus Christ in the presence of our God and Father,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: knowing, brothers and sisters, beloved by God, His choice of you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for our gospel did not come to you in word only, but also in power and in the Holy Spirit and with full conviction; just as you know what kind of men we proved to be among you for your sakes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You also became imitators of us and of the Lord, having received the word during great affliction with the joy of the Holy Spirit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that you became an example to all the believers in Macedonia and Achaia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the word of the Lord has sounded forth from you, not only in Macedonia and Achaia, but in every place the news of your faith toward God has gone out, so that we have no need to say anything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they themselves report about us as to the kind of reception we had with you, and how you turned to God from idols to serve a living and true God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to wait for His Son from heaven, whom He raised from the dead, that is, Jesus who rescues us from the wrath to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you yourselves know, brothers and sisters, that our reception among you was not in vain,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but after we had already suffered and been treated abusively in Philippi, as you know, we had the boldness in our God to speak to you the gospel of God amid much opposition.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For our exhortation does not come from error or impurity or by way of deceit;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but just as we have been approved by God to be entrusted with the gospel, so we speak, not intending to please people, but to please God, who examines our hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we never came with flattering speech, as you know, nor with a pretext for greed—God is our witness—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor did we seek honor from people, either from you or from others, though we could have asserted our authority as apostles of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we proved to be gentle among you. As a nursing mother tenderly cares for her own children,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in the same way we had a fond affection for you and were delighted to share with you not only the gospel of God, but also our own lives, because you had become very dear to us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you recall, brothers and sisters, our labor and hardship: it was by working night and day so as not to be a burden to any of you, that we proclaimed to you the gospel of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are witnesses, and so is God, of how devoutly and rightly and blamelessly we behaved toward you believers;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: just as you know how we were exhorting and encouraging and imploring each one of you as a father would his own children,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that you would walk in a manner worthy of the God who calls you into His own kingdom and glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason we also constantly thank God that when you received the word of God which you heard from us, you accepted it not as the word of mere men, but as what it really is, the word of God, which also is at work in you who believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you, brothers and sisters, became imitators of the churches of God in Christ Jesus that are in Judea, for you also endured the same sufferings at the hands of your own countrymen, even as they did from the Jews,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who both killed the Lord Jesus and the prophets, and drove us out. They are not pleasing to God, but hostile to all people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: hindering us from speaking to the Gentiles so that they may be saved; with the result that they always reach the limit of their sins. But wrath has come upon them fully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we, brothers and sisters, having been orphaned from you by absence for a short while—in person, not in spirit—were all the more eager with great desire to see your face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we wanted to come to you—I, Paul, more than once—and Satan hindered us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For who is our hope, or joy or crown of pride, in the presence of our Lord Jesus at His coming? Or is it not indeed you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you are our glory and joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, when we could no longer endure it, we thought it best to be left behind, alone at Athens,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and we sent Timothy, our brother and God’s fellow worker in the gospel of Christ, to strengthen and encourage you for the benefit of your faith,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that no one would be disturbed by these afflictions. For you yourselves know that we have been destined for this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For even when we were with you, we kept telling you in advance that we were going to suffer affliction; and so it happened, as you know.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason, when I could no longer endure it, I also sent to find out about your faith, for fear that the tempter might have tempted you, and our labor would be for nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now that Timothy has come to us from you, and has brought us good news of your faith and love, and that you always think kindly of us, longing to see us just as we also long to see you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for this reason, brothers and sisters, in all our distress and affliction we were comforted about you through your faith;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for now we really live, if you stand firm in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what thanks can we give to God for you in return for all the joy with which we rejoice because of you before our God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as we keep praying most earnestly night and day that we may see your faces, and may complete what is lacking in your faith?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now may our God and Father Himself, and our Lord Jesus, direct our way to you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and may the Lord cause you to increase and overflow in love for one another, and for all people, just as we also do for you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that He may establish your hearts blameless in holiness before our God and Father at the coming of our Lord Jesus with all His saints.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Finally then, brothers and sisters, we request and urge you in the Lord Jesus, that as you received instruction from us as to how you ought to walk and please God (just as you actually do walk), that you excel even more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you know what instructions we gave you by the authority of the Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is the will of God, your sanctification; that is, that you abstain from sexual immorality;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that each of you know how to possess his own vessel in sanctification and honor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not in lustful passion, like the Gentiles who do not know God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that no one violate the rights and take advantage of his brother or sister in the matter, because the Lord is the avenger in all these things, just as we also told you previously and solemnly warned you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God has not called us for impurity, but in sanctification.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, the one who rejects this is not rejecting man, but the God who gives His Holy Spirit to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as to the love of the brothers and sisters, you have no need for anyone to write to you, for you yourselves are taught by God to love one another;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for indeed you practice it toward all the brothers and sisters who are in all Macedonia. But we urge you, brothers and sisters, to excel even more,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to make it your ambition to lead a quiet life and attend to your own business and work with your hands, just as we instructed you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that you will behave properly toward outsiders and not be in any need.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we do not want you to be uninformed, brothers and sisters, about those who are asleep, so that you will not grieve as indeed the rest of mankind do, who have no hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if we believe that Jesus died and rose from the dead, so also God will bring with Him those who have fallen asleep through Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we say this to you by the word of the Lord, that we who are alive and remain until the coming of the Lord will not precede those who have fallen asleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord Himself will descend from heaven with a shout, with the voice of the archangel and with the trumpet of God, and the dead in Christ will rise first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then we who are alive, who remain, will be caught up together with them in the clouds to meet the Lord in the air, and so we will always be with the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, comfort one another with these words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as to the periods and times, brothers and sisters, you have no need of anything to be written to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you yourselves know full well that the day of the Lord is coming just like a thief in the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they are saying, “Peace and safety!” then sudden destruction will come upon them like labor pains upon a pregnant woman, and they will not escape.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you, brothers and sisters, are not in darkness, so that the day would overtake you like a thief;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for you are all sons of light and sons of day. We are not of night nor of darkness;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so then, let’s not sleep as others do, but let’s be alert and sober.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For those who sleep, sleep at night, and those who are drunk, get drunk at night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But since we are of the day, let’s be sober, having put on the breastplate of faith and love, and as a helmet, the hope of salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God has not destined us for wrath, but for obtaining salvation through our Lord Jesus Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who died for us, so that whether we are awake or asleep, we will live together with Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, encourage one another and build one another up, just as you also are doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we ask you, brothers and sisters, to recognize those who diligently labor among you and are in leadership over you in the Lord, and give you instruction,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that you regard them very highly in love because of their work. Live in peace with one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We urge you, brothers and sisters, admonish the unruly, encourage the fainthearted, help the weak, be patient with everyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See that no one repays another with evil for evil, but always seek what is good for one another and for all people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rejoice always,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: pray without ceasing,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in everything give thanks; for this is the will of God for you in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not quench the Spirit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: do not utterly reject prophecies,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but examine everything; hold firmly to that which is good,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: abstain from every form of evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now may the God of peace Himself sanctify you entirely; and may your spirit and soul and body be kept complete, without blame at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Faithful is He who calls you, and He also will do it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brothers and sisters, pray for us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Greet all the brothers and sisters with a holy kiss.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I put you under oath by the Lord to have this letter read to all the brothers and sisters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
